name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
I admit that I was a little indifferent when I posted this message today, probably because I have seen similar things many times and there is some dangerous numbness in my heart.
I just received a lot of submissions. The armed police entered the community in a line with shields in hand, which really shocked me. I donâ€™t know what made them face a three-year-old ghost so seriously - until I saw that the people in Lanzhou did not run away when scolded, but mocked and cursed at the shields.
I realized that children are the bottom line

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
In traditional Chinese concepts, we regard our offspring as our future.
No matter how hard and tired we are, we must do our best to support our offspring.
When children are exhausted and die at the door because they cannot leave the community due to epidemic prevention, the claim that epidemic prevention is "for the elderly and children" becomes a self-defeating lie.
Because it is obvious that, yes, our children will not die from the new coronavirus, but if our children get other diseases, there is no solution.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: After three years of fighting the epidemic, we are still only preventing the new coronavirus, and there is still no plan to deal with other sudden diseases when the city is closed. If other countries in the world are just lying down in their epidemic prevention efforts, then this is giving up.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Zhengzhou seems to have been making some attempts recently

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
The Weibo comment about the death of a three-year-old child due to prevention and control measures in Lanzhou became the number one trending search, but was removed in about half an hour.
Perhaps these rulers will never understand why the death of a three-year-old child can suddenly make people dare to speak out loudly about things they didn't dare to say in the past?

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Some netizens provided some information about the internal group of online commentators.
I can only say that once people enter this industry, they tend to think that everything is as simple as their own thoughts.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
@Alex999_dn Yes, that's also a point.
I have posted a lot of content, all of which have received more than 10,000 likes. I thought the police came to me because of those contents.
Actually, it was not because I posted a content about Tibet with 400 likes.
So I think their bottom line is actually very clear. Even if you insult others and post real things, it may not be a big deal, but content related to Tibet and Xinjiang is absolutely forbidden.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: I am often torn between the future society described in political books and the reality of life where everyone is in danger. If lies are told often enough, they can become truth. Then what is the meaning of reading? Marx said that universal and universal truths cannot be called truth. People spend their entire lives studying saints and sages in the vain hope of glimpsing a little bit of truth. But at night, I only see lives disappearing and hear the widespread grief. Articles are full of peaceful events, but they are unwilling to bow their heads to see the common people.

A community in Urumqi was sealed off for three months. In the video, two young people called on everyone to go with them to find the leader to ask for an explanation.
"He arrested the two of us, and there are 10,000 of me behind us"

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Teacher Li, I am a painter. The news I see every day recently makes me sad and depressed every day, but people in reality seem to be doing what they should be doing. I can no longer see the meaning of studying courses in art academies and the meaning of going to college. I feel that those who quietly left because of the despair of controlled life left in vain. And, what can I do? I drew this picture out of my sense of powerlessness towards history.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
In the early morning of November 2, a netizen posted on Weibo that her mother was a history teacher at the Third Middle School in Xinzheng City, Henan Province.
During the online class on the evening of the 28th, a student purchased online class blasters and used various vile and despicable means to disrupt the order of the live class. He repeatedly provoked her mother through voice abuse, screen sharing, and other methods. After the online class, her mother collapsed alone at home. Two days later, she was found and confirmed to have died of a heart attack.
